Nunc dignissim luctus enim sit amet dapibus.

sw.name: Daniel
message: Hello Steph, (Daniel)

This is gonna be your SSO note too because I don’t like repeating the same stuff over again. Even though I didn’t have a mentor that I could make sense of things, thank you for being one of the few older ones that I could be open to about stuff in my life and just help make sense of my situation. I also appreciate the fact that you were open to all the suggestions and ideas that I had even though some of them were damn harsh, but I think that just shows how open you were and how much you cared about making things better. With all the tears, work, and sacrifice that you have put into AACF, I hope that we can continue to build that. I’m not throwing shade or anything but just being 100 percent real. You should have shown your fun side more because there’s no way I believe that you’re like who you are in AACF all the time. I get it though and I don’t blame you. Have fun in San Diego with Candace and come visit us when you’re in Seattle. Hopefully if I see you again, Candace has not taught you the ABG ways.

sw.name: Zach C
message: Hi Stephanie! I just wanted to say that you've been a fantastic CC for AACF this year. I appreciate your dedication and time that it takes to prepare every week of AACF and how you make every Wednesday night and every AACF event the best days of the week. Your positivity and your smile is also really encouraging and welcoming to everyone that you meet. Thanks for being a great leader and an awesome sister in Christ! I hope after you graduate that your relationship with God will be just as awesome as this year was.

sw.name: Lewis
message: My dearest Stephanie,

I believe I called it very early on that we’ll probably end up graduating together. Through the past way too many years, I’ve always been frustrated with myself for taking so long but it’s clear that God has a way to bring about good in all things, even if we don’t see any good ourselves. Every year of delay for me has been another year to be able to see you grow into the strong, independent woman that you are. I am consistently proud and even inspired by you and I hope that I can continue to encourage you when you are doubting yourself. After all, I am your #1 fan. It has truly been a joy to get to know you and I assure you this won’t be the last time we see each other. I will travel to where you are. May the Lord guide you in every step of the way in your next stages of life. Go and conquer the world.

sw.name: Ryan Leung.
message: Hey Steph!

It’s been a good ride. You are a kind-hearted person, and I hope that you enough affirmation for that fact. The world honestly needs more people like you. You’ve done an awesome job running the AACF show and I am proud to see how selfless you are. I am also so proud to see you grow as a person through our four years in college. It’s so incredibly cool to see you become a stronger and more confident person. Love God forever, and I hope our paths cross in the future. Take care, and goodbye Steph! Do me a solid and find a dude that’s just as pure-hearted as you. Let me know too!

sw.name: Joseph Tsang
message: To Stephanie Wan

Thanks for putting up with a dumb freshmen like me Steph! Even though I was probably hella annoying and immature, I was glad that you welcomed everyone with open arms, and exuded a level of kindness and tolerance that far exceeds mine. You helped a lot of people in AACF. Please feel appreciated. I’ll write more mushy stuff later.
To my favorite boomer in AACF

sw.name: SK
message: wow look at you popular g0rl!! so many notes!!

i’m so happy to see you fill the shoes of the people you looked up to before. not that i regret taking more time to focus on academics, but if i could change things, it would have been to visit AACF more often and see you be the great leader you are!! i can’t believe you’re doing grad school now too. wow. so excite!! i would love to catch up w you sometime. preferably in real life. if you’re sticking around, that would be convenient and s0 very l0vely~~ but if you’re going away lol rip. ugh i’ll settle for a call sometime too tho. definitely miss meesum runs and bake nights with u! :( and finally, please continue to be the amazing Godly woman you are!! people really look to you. people really love you.

sw.name: Evan Hao
message: Dear Steph,

Wow. There is honestly so much I can write about. I probably do not even know where to start. I guess I’ll start off with some things or memories that really stuck out to me. At that new year’s “party,” you cleaned and managed everything without anyone telling you. You hosted many events that I didn’t initially know you hosted. You are by far, one of the most selfless people I’ve ever met. Before I came to college, people like u only exists in rumors. However, when I actually found someone as selfless, sunshine-happy, and caring as you, I was honestly shaken. “Dang, people like this actually exist. I didn’t even know it was possible.” I am really upset I couldn’t see your graduation in real-time and that I couldn’t say my last goodbyes. To me, you were a role model of what a seeker of God looks like, and I really hope your endeavors outside of college will be as much of a blessing as you were to me. Thanks for making my first year in college an amazing one, and I hope that your senior was great too.
Have a great Summer life after college 😊,

vs.name: 哥哥
message: My dearest 妹妹,

I don’t really know what to say that you didn’t already know. You understand how I care about you and there’s probably nothing else better in life. It’s been an honor watching you grow, struggle, hurt and also challenge yourself. You once said that you were envious of the relationship I have with Stephanie but I think everyone’s relationship with everyone is different. Each one has a different need and dynamic and that’s completely okay. I know that through whatever, at the end I’ll be able to talk to you but also confront you about things. I pray that you may receive peace for the next stage of your life, knowing that the Lord is with you every step of the way. And I will be there too to assist in any way that I can.

vs.name: Ryan Leung.
message: Sup Vee!

Vee I know our interactions have been few, but I just wanna let you know that I really enjoy talking with you. Maybe it’s because of the Canto blood, but I’ve always felt very at-home when we talk. I think that is something you just have as a gift from God: Hospitality. Keep that gift. I know that our personal relationships with other people in the past are intertwined in a way, but I am glad that we’ve been able to talk about that and gain some form of closure. I really do hope that you continue living a blessed life with people that care about you. I hope that our paths cross in the future, and if that time comes, we should take the time to catch up! Take good care of yourself and goodbye, Vanessa!

vs.name: Jojo
message: Vee!!!

Thanks for everything you’ve done for AACF! I’m sure you’ve done a lot of things for aacf, and I’m sure you’ve helped a lot of people. Hope that you’ll continue to do great things! I know you’ll do great.

vs.name: SK
message: uhh excuse me?
the title of this document… there’s no way your name was spelled “Vee” all this time. it was definitely just one letter right? “V.”

it’s been a while since we last caught up!! i hope you’re on track to graduate LOL but more importantly, i hope you’re finding good anime to watch. i’m glad to see so many of the underclassmen look up to you and you being so welcoming to them. v nice v nice. if you’re still around the area next year please come by and say hello! would love to see you in person again 0mg

vs.name: Marques Mar
message: V!

You were one of the very first people I met at UW! It has been a great two years of getting to know each other more. Thanks for being open to talk and being a fun person to be around. I hope that you have a great rest of your year at Zoom University!
Vanessa
Here is a random message because you said you wrote to me and I have to write back. HAGS
Sincerely, Evan

PS: Lol just kidding. Hi veeeeeeee (E-girl gamer for short). Honestly, this year showed me that the power of seniors. Frickin op gamers. Anyways, I am really glad I got to meet you at AACF. I think I met you the first time at the camp, and it was a pleasure to taco bell to you 😊. RIP senior year though, all good things come to an end, unfortunately, and probably the last time I met you will be the last time I see you ☹. However, I really hope you everything is blessed whatever you plan on doing (maybe make this a later convo), and never stop being yourself.
PSS: uhhh about that hotpot burner, do you want me to buy it or…… LOL
PSSS: Rip typos I wrote this 15 minutes before the deadline.

sh.name: Lewis
message: Hello other meimei,

I really enjoyed having you around in AACF. I think you bring a unique spice to everyone’s life… while also providing to the Yin to V’s Yang. I appreciate the little bit of laughter you bring to the room.

sh.name: Jed
message: Hi Susan!
I'm sorry to hear about your arrest. Are you doing well?

First off, I wanted to thank you for coming to my small group. It's encouraging to me that you make an effort to show up. I have lots of fun chatting with you, whether it be about yourself, homework struggles, or not knowing your own parents LOL.
Though school is already over for me, I hope for the best for you!
See you around!

sh.name: Not KevK
message: Hey Susan,
Zoom for Four was fun. Hang in there, we’re almost done with spring quarter. Keep staying healthy… at the very least, until Senior Send-Off ;)
[To be continued… when SSO rolls around]

sh.name: Evan Hao
message: Herro Susan,

Sorry I don’t think we interacted that much (probably because you’re super popular and too busy), but I wanted to say you were honestly really fun and energetic when I had the opportunity to hang with you. For example, it was really notable through the study sessions, and you were never failed to make me laugh (whether it be directly or indirectly). I’m sorry I couldn’t say goodbye when you graduate (frickin corona), but I hope what endeavors you pursue will be a great one. <3
Some random AACF person,

mt.name: Josh
message: Michelle,

Thank you for all the behind the scenes work that you do to support core and the community of AACF. I think I can speak for a lot of people in that we appreciate all the work and planning that goes into each large group and we’re really thankful that you’ve done so much for AACF this past year! I know that sometimes people can’t see the way you see things and misunderstandings come about, but your perseverance and testimony really encourages me in my own journey too. Even though you won’t be on core the coming year, I pray that you can continue to support the community as someone in the congregation (I read this and I feel like it can come off in a not positive way, but what I mean is like someone who isn’t shouldering the responsibility of LG planner anymore).

mt.name: Zach C
message: Michelle Tsang

Hi Michelle! Thank you so much for being an awesome sister in Christ! Thank you for your hard work and dedication to making each week at AACF so enjoyable and so much fun. You and the rest of the Core team have done an amazing job making Wednesday nights the most encouraging and memorable nights of the week. I appreciate that you say hi to everyone and it makes everyone feel welcome when they step into AACF. I hope that as you continue your walk with God outside of AACF it would inspire others the same way it does when you inspire people in AACF.

mt.name: Lewis
message: Mee-shell,

It has been so much fun laughing with you and talking crap about people in Canto. I’m always impressed with the way you capture people’s attention and keep people in line. You’ve graduated from one of the new AACF babies to being everyone’s mom and that is so wonderful. I hope you continue to do so your senior year.

mt.name: Your brother
message: Hey Sis,
Keep up the work. Thanks for serving in AACF.

mt.name: Ryan Leung
message: Hey Michelle,

You are definitely fun to be around. I know that the bois may not appreciate you that much because of whatever reasons, but I personally appreciate you and what you do for the people around you. Thank you for all the time and effort you’ve put into AACF. Seriously. That’s some real dedication and true selflessness. I know we don’t hang or talk often, but I want to let you know that I really enjoyed our talk from last year while drink C Fruit Life/GuoC 100/whatever that mf place is called lmao. My philosophy is that everyone’s story is worth hearing, no matter how they are perceived by other people. When we had that long talk, it really exemplified that philosophy. I hope you enjoy the last year of your college career and I hope you get to enjoy life after it too! Keep on doing your thing, and I pray that Jo will someday appreciate you more. Take care of yourself and find yourself a man that’s worthy of your time. God bless and goodbye, Michelle.

mt.name: Marques
message: Michelle,

Pretty crazy that we’ve known eachother since High School. I was really glad when I first enrolled at the U, that you were at AACF. Thank you for all your work that you put into AACF, it means a lot that you are dedicated to AACF. I am also glad we got to know each other a little better through LTC, the retreat and AACF in general. Thanks for always being very supportive and keep on being you! I wish you a great rest of the year!

mt.name: Jedo
message: Hello,
It's me. It was about time you were arrested for your repeated heists. After all, I was the one that tipped off the cops. Though, by the time you read this, you'll probably already have broken out.

First off, thanks for all the work you put in. I don't know how much of an effort you felt like you were making, but to me, it seemed like you were trying your best to live life to the fullest. Whether it be your career, your relationships, or your beliefs, I feel like you've set a pretty high bar to beat for those around you. I have a feeling you don't think that it was much, but I appreciate your sincerity (or attempts thereof), and your willingness to put yourself out there. To me, it seemed like you lived out what you wanted to convey to other people. That's rad.
See you on another island, brother from another rudder.

mt.name: George
message: Hi Mixhelle!

Thanks for doing so much for AACF. Can’t imagine what it’s going to be like without you at the helm anymore haha --doesn’t mean that it won’t be as good, it just means that the work you do isn’t replaceable. I know that it seems like I’m always bothered by your antics, but I’m really gonna miss having you nagging me constantly. We have opposite sleep schedules, but the few times we’ve managed to hang out I’ve had a lot of fun. Sometimes I really can’t tell if you’re truly having fun or just pretending like you are, but I think I’ve learned enough about you to tell that you love what you do and you’re bold enough to put yourself out there for the sake of others. Thanks for always messaging me from time to time and trying to cheer me up. It’ll probably be a long time before we see each other again, but this won’t be the last time I get to talk to you. Haha maybe next time I’ll even have some sense of fashion. Anyway, see you on that food tour.

kx.name: Marques Mar
message: Dear Kath,

It has been a blessing to get to know you this past year at UW! I will always remember the amazing time that we shared at LTC where we first met! I always appreciate that you always laugh at my dumb jokes and to put a smile on my face when we see eachother! It's crazy that you're graduating in the fall already, that is nuts. I hope you have an amazing summer and I hope you stay healthy through this time. Thanks again for being my friend.
Best,

kx.name: Josh
message: Hey Kath,

Thank you for supporting AACF through outreach and FISHIES this past year and making efforts to make the freshmen feel welcome, even though you returned from China before winter quarter. Your charismatic and cheerful spirits never fail to make others around you feel comforted and at home! We may have not known each other for long, but for some reason you always seem to laugh at a lot of things and that kinda lifts my spirits up ngl. Anyways, even though you’re gonna be graduating next quarter (that’s really fast OwO), I hope we can get to know each other better before you go :)

kx.name: Ryan Leung.
message: Hi Kath,

You are a big clown LMAO. Man, we’ve had some good times not gonna lie. From accounting and up until these dumb Zoom meetings where I have your face as the background HAHAHA. I really appreciate the energy you bring in many scenarios. It’s so chaotic but also so fun. Not gonna lie, you and Patrice were a formidable pair that I will always be afraid of. I hope the story arc with you and Jed workout. I’m placing my bet that you two will continue to be an awesome pair. Invite me to the wedding dude and then the baby shower and then the second baby shower and then Jed’s retirement and then your retirement and then Jed’s funeral and then your funeral. Put it in your will right now. It should state “In the event of my death, Ryan Leung is invited to my funeral lmao”. Kath I’m really gonna miss hanging out and messing with you. Enjoy the rest of college and really take care of yourself afterward too. I really hope our paths cross again, I can’t wait until the next time when my blood vessels burst. Stay awesome, God bless, and goodbye, Kath. Katherout!

kx.name: Leo Tsai
message: Kath,
Obligatory Jed is mine.

Thanks for always being fun to be around because you laugh at everything lol. I wish corona dies down soon so we can have our third wheel (not me) hangouts. Hope you find out what you want to do in the future, looking forward to seeing what’s in store for you!

kx.name: see you soon?
message: Hi,
I believe you may have been wrongly incarcerated, but man, that was pretty heartless of you.

Miss you lots! Come back soon so we can play games and chat together. Whenever your internet connection lags out...um, the call drops. I know you're anxious and stressed and everything and I admire the struggle you're making. You count yourself short a lot of the times, but you should feel empowered to take your chances. If you fail, you can be sure that I'll be there to support you.
Love you!

kx.name: Evan Hao
message: Kathyrine

Hi Katherine! You’re such an epic memer tbh. You never stop me from laughing. I am really I got to see you this quarter, and I think you act just like your sister (a clown). I hope to get to know you more next year, and hopefully this year was amazing for you too.
我是苹果,

sc.name: Zach C
message: Hi Sammi! Thanks for being an awesome sister in Christ, and for being welcoming and willing to chat with everyone you meet. You're a fun person to talk to and you bring up helpful advice and ideas in AACF when we're in the small groups after a sermon. I appreicate that you say hi to everyone and get to know how they're doing. I hope you continue to grow in your relationship with God and that it would inspire others at AACF.

sc.name: Leo Tsai
message: Sammi,

Thanks for always checking in on me, whether it be about Small Group, school, or just life in general. I appreciate it a lot and hope that you’ve been adjusting to life in Seattle. Let me know if you ever want to talk.

sc.name: Jed
message: Hello thief.
Bears are free animals. Leave Ice Bear alone.

But I know if you took Ice Bear, you'd give him all the love and care that he would need. You have a good heart for those around you, and I really experienced that this year. You're very honest in the way you do things. Whenever you have responsibilities, I feel like you don't let yourself relax until they're done. I respect that, but it also makes me feel like I have to see things through to the end when I help you or else you'll never let yourself play Animal Crossing. It's okay to have some "cheat" days haha, you deserve it!

sc.name: George
message: Saaaammiiiiiiiiii,

We barely hang out, but we should. Sometime. Some year. At some donut shop. Anyway, thanks for always being willing to help me, especially for info apps haha (it’s not your fault, don’t worry about it). I’m gonna miss seeing you at AACF or whenever I crash your apartment (sorry for always crashing your apartment), and I wish we got to spend more time exploring donut shops. Anyway, if things go back to normal soon let’s go get donuts somewhere around here. And when I go back to Seattle you better have some answers for where the best donuts are.
Cheers!

ak.name: Josh
message: Anique,

I still remember that day in September when we first met and you drove me home after your friend’s baptism; the conversation we had still sticks with me and I am always reminded and driven by it to be the best I can be for God. Even though we haven’t talked as much, I know how much joy you bring to your junior sisters and probably to your sisters from SCAC that aren’t in AACF as well. I pray you can continue to be a great disciple of Jesus, bring joy to others and be someone who is always willing to drive others like you did for me.

P.S. Coming from HK, I never realised what it really meant to willingly drive another person from place to place. Now, I’ve realised you scarified a lot: time that could’ve been used for something else, gas that could’ve been used for another errand or to go home and the money that goes with it. I really appreciate that! :)

ak.name: Leo Tsai
message: Anique,

Thanks for always being so kind and chill whenever we hang out. We didn’t really get to this year, but hopefully corona clears up by the end of the year so we have more opportunities to. I’ll be looking forward to it, stay safe!

ak.name: SK
message: lolol hello

summer feels like so long ago and that phase was.. a little weird. but i hope you’re doing well and that you’ve gotten better at gamepigeon games. i will be waiting for u to challenge me again. i dunno what you’ve been doing recently but i hope we get a chance to catch up :D for always have a welcoming smile to greet people, you are great. keep doing that! miss you!

ak.name: Jed
message: HEllO,
You have great taste in Animal Crossing. I still can't get over the fact that the name of your island is broniquely. It sounds like a fashion brand almost LOL.

I enjoy the sincerity and energy that you have. You really seem to live freely, and you tackle on issues that you encounter with your all (and with the help of friends). The amount of openness and excitement that I see from you is refreshing in a way. I think everyone could use a bit of Anique in their life. KEEP BEING BRONIQUE!
Oh yeah and thanks for taking care of Kath.

ak.name: George
message: Hi Aneeq,

It’s so weird how we can not talk for like weeks, and then when we hang out we can still be best friends for the day. You always have something new to bring up, and I appreciate that you’re always willing to share it with me. I wish I could give you better advice, but I feel like we just have two different takes on how to approach the world. And although I super judge you for that, I think that deep down we have a lot of similar values. When it comes down to it, I feel like a lot of people tell you that the choices that you make are wrong and that you should do things differently, but I think that there’s something to take from your side of things and I appreciate the advice you give me. If I happen to be studying in Cali next year, come visit and I’ll take you around. It’s the least I can do in return for always having you ferry me all over the place in Seattle. Oh and on that note, thanks for letting me drive your car lol. Cheers, good luck, and live without regrets.

ks.name: Jed
message: Hello!
I haven't seemed to talk to you much outside of LTC, but hey, I haven't forgotten that either! You were pretty quick on your feet for improv haha.
I think it's really awesome that you come out to AACF for these events. Thanks for that, and I hope you're doing well at UW Bothell!

df.name: Jun
message: Hey Danielle! Hope you're doing well in this quarantine season. I just want you to know that we appreciate you coming to AACF! Probably the most memorable thing was when we were in Oasis playing Egyptian something card game. I apologize for being so loud and aggressive, but I hope it wasn’t a bad time haha. Stay healthy! Stay away from COVID cuz I heard it’s pretty bad if you catch it. Hope to see you more often next year when school (hopefully?) is in-person again.

df.name: Ted
message: Hey Danielle,

It was nice playing Jenga with you at the Table4Four afterparty last quarter. I hope that you are enjoying your time in AACF and that you feel appreciated tonight. Hope you stay safe during this season of distancing and have fun tonight. God Bless!

jl.name: Zach C
message: Hi Joyce! Thanks for being an awesome sister in Christ. From the few times we have met or been in the same small group after sermon, you've been encouraging and inspiring. I appreciate that you are welcoming to other people into AACF and that you bring joy to others when you talk with them. I hope you continue to grow in your relationship with God and that it would continue to inspire others the same way it has inspired me.

jl.name: Lewis
message: Hello Joyce,

My favorite thing about you is that your personality is so much louder than your voice. You are incredibly quiet and I wish you weren’t because I want the whole world to hear you and the joy that you bring. I love the way your brighten the room with your smile and I’m going to miss you very much. You are very appreciated.

jl.name: Ryan Leung
message: Hi Joyce,

Big clown and big funny, you hold these qualities and I will never forget how enjoyable it is to hang out with you. Yes, I get headaches because of your chaotic energy. It never meant that I didn’t enjoy that. I enjoy how honest you are when you express yourself. The straightforward critiques that you dish out on anyone or anything such as AACF is honestly so refreshing LOL. I am lowkey kinda bummed out that I won’t be able to continue watching your madness in close proximity anymore, but let me know when you’re bugging Daniel or some new kid. I’ll make time to come to your graduation. Continue to grow into a stronger person. As you clown harder, the closer you’ll grow with God. Cheers to life and take care of yourself!

jl.name: Joseph Tsang
message: To the GREATEST CLOWN

Joyce you’re honestly the biggest clown I know. Despite all the crap I give you though, you’re actually pretty amazing. You really have a heart to serve God, and I saw it really early on. I remember seeing you run the tent during fall quarter, and despite the cold and rain, you were there, welcoming me to worship with you. I know that you don’t really like Seattle, but I don’t want to make it seem like the relationships that you built with people here are meaningless. You mean a lot of people here, and I hope that people here mean a lot to you. You really have a heart to do a lot of stuff, I’m glad that you decided to serve at AACF. I’m glad that I have a couple more years to clown on you, but more than that, I’m looking forward to see what you continue to do for God!

jl.name: SK
message: j0yce!!!!
Read Daniel 3! >:0

jk haha idk if you were planning to or not but it seems like we left off there. it’s been a while since we’ve actually huh out or talked about the goodie goodie stuff u know? i definitely miss chillin w you outside during nocturnal hours. honestly, you’re a pretty big inspiration. you’ve swallowed hard truths, you’ve stumbled, and you’ve danced to too many tiktok songs, but in the end you get back up and stick with your guns. that’s pretty amazing. i look up to you in that regard. please keep doing what makes God happy and i hope you are blessed with multitudes of happiness :’)

jl.name: Jed
message: Hi.
You're kinda like Patrice V2. No wonder you went wild. I hope you reflect during your time in prison.

Though, you are better than Patrice (in some ways). You are much more considerate and have a heart devoted to God. Out of everyone in AACF, I believe that about you the most. Honestly, part of the reason I agreed to being a small group co-lead was because I already saw that about you, though I barely talked to you before then. Your trust and faith may cause you to encounter difficult situations, but know this:

Be confident in yourself! You have good qualities that shine through the dark times. Of course, that's not to say you don't have things you should work on, but you are a great person! Also please plan small group.

jl.name: Marques
message: JOYCE

Wow we’ve known each other for just a couple years (Actually we met at SAD last year), but hey its been pretty great getting to know you. You are a really funny, weird and overall a huge clown. But in all seriousness, I see that you have such a love and passion to do the Lord's work, whether we're reading verses or talking about Jesus, I feel the radiance of genuinity when we talk about the Lord. I am so glad to be your friend and I am really proud of how far you’ve come. Please come back to Seattle soon.

jl.name: George
message: Hi Joce,

You’ll probably never stop misspelling my name lol but nicknames are, at the very least, an indication that you care about those people. So thanks, I guess? Anyway, it’s been super encouraging watching you grow up from the beginning of last year until now. I know that you definitely have a heart for people, but it’s still super inspiring to see everything that you do for them. I know some of us felt like your sudden change would just be a short phase, but you’ve proved us wrong. You’ve done so much more than anyone could have asked for, and still you desire to do more. Thanks for being my favorite small group leader and all-around good friend. I’m going to miss your signature Joyce vibes (uhh I don’t know how to generalize it but ask anyone and they probably know exactly what I’m talking about), so let’s find some time to hang out when you’re in the bay.

cr.name: Bill
message: Hello Cinthia,

I hope all is well with your life. You are a fun person to hang out with and I admire how you are unapologetically yourself all the time. I hope you enjoy rest of college and AACF. You are funny and a good person. I hope you not missing Snowy village too much. I’m sure you will have plenty of time to make up for all the snow you missed out on.

cr.name: Daniel
message: Hello Cinthia, (Daniel)

Ok first off you’re a clown bro. Let’s set that straight. We haven’t hung out as much, but it doesn’t feel like that everytime we do. Those times where we just laugh about the most random stuff is what I enjoy the most. That time where we were joking about Matt and Laurie and you told me to text Matt “how are you doing” and then he was in Ode with us was one of the funniest moments that quarter. Also I hate you for sexually harassing me that night because dawg you gotta chill with the tickling dude. That’s clown type material right there. Deadass though I hope that you find a dude that’s good for you because it’s been a hot minute since you’ve had one. I’m only gonna say this because I’m supposed to appreciate you. Thanks for being willing to not just give a damn (I had to use this because other ppl are gonna see this) about anything and just being yourself because that’s when people are the most fun. Keep being like that and come down to Cali again if you can. Peace out.

cr.name: Ryan. P.S. seven.
message: Sup Cinthia,

I’m sure other people have already called you this already but… Bro you a clown LMAO. Listen, not gonna lie, it’s honestly been so fun getting to know you more this year. You are an incredibly funny and caring individual. The world needs more people like you, so keep at it, man. Thanks for all those wild Friday/Saturday nights with the gang. I think that may have completed my whole college experience HAHA. I hope you continue to live life well and make sure to continue standing your ground as an individual. Find a dude that’s not a man-thot. Find a guy that’s actually worth your time, don’t waste your time playing/getting played, you feel? Long term dude. Anyway, let me know when most of y’all are 21 so I can celebrate with y’all at some bars or something. Nothing too ghetto though, I have “some” dignity left HAHA. May God be with you always.

cr.name: Phil
message: Onions on sale mi chingu!

I’m actually gonna write your whole letter in Spanish just to show how I good I am lol jk jk I’m not that racist (only a little sometimes). Anywayyy I hope you’ve been well even during all this crazy time and I was gonna speak for you this year since you spoke for me last year but that’s not really possible :( It’s been a fat minute and I miss eating at Kong with you and Laurie but don’t worry because I’ll come visit to hang out as soon as possible! When it comes down to it you’re super hilarious, fun, energetic, and just a good friend. I love laughing and sharing good times with you and it’s gonna be sad to not see you as often. One of these days I’ll cook ramen out of a glass container that is long in length with a round base (gotta be ambiguous lol) and I’ll let you know how that goes. But until then, stay healthy, stay happy, and stay you sis!

cr.name: SK
message: u h0e,
As a very integral part of my AACF experience, I must say that I have missed you. Harassing you is always the highlight of my day :’) ah, the good ol’ days…
But really, you are a big reason why as to why I miss AACF and I shall do better to see everyone next year 8) esp you!!!
Thanks for playing along with me and being a good sport and always catching me when I spontaneously (trust) fall. Legend.
C u soon!

cr.name: Evan Hao
message: Cinthia
HAGS.
H- Happy. You were a pleasure to hang out with, and honestly one of the funniest people I’ve ever met.
A- Aextraordinary. Because I am too lazy to get the acronyms right, but I really do think you are extraordinary. Don’t stop being yourself gurl.
G- Great. Uhhh I’m running out of ideas but It’s around the lines of you being a great person 😊
S- Selfless. Honestly, whether you believe it not, to me, you are a very selfless person (sometimes over selfless)
Yours truly,

tl.name: Josh
message: Tiph,

I appreciate you studying with me in CS 143 the last quarter; having someone else to complain to about the course and make jokes in Cantonese is hard to come by haha. You’ve been the anchor that’s kept me grounded in my HK roots and you’re even more local than I am and I’m more “fresh” from HK LOL. Your stupid jokes, whether Chinese or not, always make me laugh a lot and I really appreciate that. Here’s to hoping we can continue to do the same in the coming years :)

tl.name: Jo
message: TIPH!

What’s up fam. We’ve known each other for a pretty long time now. From our early church days until now, I’m glad that I have someone like you in my life. Even though you like to talk down on yourself you probably grind like a million times harder than I do, and hopefully I can do that one day too. INFO 200 and INFO 201 was way better because of you, and I enjoy your company in my classes. I hope you continue to find great friends, cause you deserve a lot more. I hope I’m not too annoying, and hopefully we can continue to be good friends throughout college. You’re lowkey a genius in somehow being a lazy but also hella smart and hardworking all at the same time, and I know you deserve all the success that you gain. Best in luck in finding a career that provides you with phat stacks.

tl.name: Leo Tsai
message: Tiph,

Thanks for suffering with me through Koblitz, it was a wild ride. It’s been fun having you come to AACF more often this year and messing around in Alder. Good luck on getting into CS, I’m sure you will because you’re so hardworking and smart.

tl.name: Evan
message: Tiph,

I remember when we first met at retreat, I pretty much only talked to you because of how awkward our table was. I’m so glad I did though. We made some pretty stupid memories over the quarter Like staying up until 3 am watching your Kpop group videos (that you unironically enjoy) and watching dumb videos when we should have been studying. Honestly I’m half surprised you even showed up most of the time because you barely came to any of the events and would always come to alder like 5 hours after I texted you. But I digress. You’re a good friend and I’m happy we ended meeting even though I didn’t know you existed all of fall quarter. Also, congrats on making it into info!

aw.name: Bill Wang
message: Hello Ally,

I hope you doing well. You are a very nice person and I enjoy your happy energy. You are good at making people smile and being kind. You are also pretty good at pokemon go. I will miss your personality and our interesting interactions. I hope you find joy in the rest of college and AACF. It has been cool to see you grow more comfortable in your own skin.

aw.name: Leo Tsai
message: Ally,

Thanks for always being so fun to hang around with, especially making crackhead jokes around George lol. I hope things go smoothly between you and him after he leaves. Hope corona dies down by the end of the year so we can make more wacky dark jokes together!

aw.name: Phil
message: Eyyy Allyy

Thanks for always laughing at my jokes even though sometimes they’re bad LOL It’s fun making you laugh and you’re really hilarious and fun too! It’s been great planning conjoined (that’s a gross word) small group with you and Jacinda and the girls are really blessed to have you as one of their leaders. Also, we should hang since you live in Bothell, which is like 10 minutes from me. Maybe we can have a Bothell area hangout with everyone around the area someday haha. I really hope even through all this you still have reasons to smile and laugh! Stay safe, stay healthy, and stay you!

aw.name: SK
message: Hiya

You are all smiles all the time. Literally every time I see you.Whether you’re at AACF, whether you’re in ode or in your room studying(?) until 7am, you suffer through your work with a smile. I respect that. And thanks for always caring enough to ask how I’m doing when we bump into each other. Miss you guys :’)

aw.name: Jed
message: Hello.
I can't believe you don't pronounce salmon right. It must be related to why you laughed at Death Valley smh.

I'm glad you're going to be on core next year. I believe you have many ideas and inspirations that don't see the light of day because you aren't the type of person to force your opinion (other than for salmon). Being on core is not just a responsibility but an enabler as well. I think your eye for design and heart for others will service you well in your position. Keep up the good work, just respect the Valley alright?
Also, let your thoughts be heard, because I get the feeling you have some interesting perspectives. Anyways, you're a fun person. Good luck and persevere dude.

aw.name: Evan Hao
message: ALLYOOP
WEEEEEEEE.

lm.name: Bill
message: Hi Laurie,

I admire how mature you are. You give me vibes of someone who is older than me and thats pretty cool. I hope you are not having too bad of a quarter. I enjoyed playing volleyball with you and we should get that gang back together sometime - maybe on a zoom. Keep being you and enjoying life. You have a very kind soul and weird sense of humor. Bye

lm.name: Ryan *poorly done finger guns*
message: Hi Laurie,

Hey I hope life is doing well for you. Laurie, although our interactions are few, I’ve always enjoyed talking with you. You keep it real and you keep it hella funny. I can’t quite pinpoint the exact humor style you have, but it’s very high-quality humor. You have my seal of approval, madame. Thank you for those fun times at Steven’s Court LMAO. Wild, wild times. I hope you continue to have a good time in college. Enjoy life and, at some point, just stop prioritizing school as much. Trust me, don’t worry about it. Let me know when y’all turn 21 and plan on celebrating it at some point. I wanna be there for you guys hahaha. Take care and good luck in life, Laurie. I’ll do my best to visit you guys. Cling close to God too! Praying for ya!

lm.name: Phil
message: Hola Laurie,

Sorry I wasn’t able to join the volleyball team at all but honestly, I probably wouldn’t have made the cut lol I guess it wasn’t meant to be haha Anywayyy I hope you’ve been good! It’s been a fat minute since we hung out! I honestly really miss eating at Kong with you guys and I’ll come visit as soon as possible just to eat at Kong again (and maybe have a tea party lol). But I guess you live in Bothell so maybe we can just catch up at Sharetea hopefully soon maybe maybe not idk lol. All in all, you’re a super cool, hilarious, fun, and EPIC person! I’m lucky to call you a friend and so is everyone else. Since I wans’t able to have a senior trip or graduate this year maybe it actually a bad idea to be a 6th year and graduate with your class haha. Regardless, (<- that’s a big fancy word you should give me props) I really hope you’re doing good and don’t forget to stay healthy, stay happy, and stay you sis!

lm.name: Evan Hao
message: Konnichiwa Laurie,

Honestly to sum up my note: LMAO. You were honestly a blast to be around. I remember very vividly about your bees assignment during camp. You’re like a ray of sunshine without the sunshine, if you get what I mean. Honestly though, don’t stop being you. You’re funny and amazing to hang around. Thanks so much for the water when I come over. IDK why but I’m always thirsty when I come over to hang; maybe it’s my dry throat. Anyways, I hope to see you next year and let’s have another blast of a year.
How’s biology treating you? (least favorite subject btw).
HAGS,

vz.name: Matt
message: Vivia!

It was cool seeing how easily you fit into AACF with us even though it was your first year. I’m glad we found more boundless foster students to suffer with.  Thanks for always bringing the good vibes to all the hangouts and being honest and open. You’re hecka chill and easy to talk to.  I hope we can take more boundless classes together even if we fail FIN 350 :((((((. Make sure to pull up to Alhambra soon.

vz.name: Jo
message: It’s Vivia!

What’s up. It’s been pretty fun getting to know you, and it’s kinda mind boggling to know that we have so many mutual friends. It’s always fun to talk to you and get a sense of normalcy after hanging around other aacf people. I know we always like to tease you, but we’re all supportive of what you’re doing, and I’m inspired to see someone who’s taken such a different route as me. I hope you’ll continue to be successful, because I know you grind hella hard. I’ll maybe drive down to ghetto Federal Way again to visit. We gonna eat hella good Korean food.

vz.name: Leo Tsai
message: Vivia,

Thanks for coming to AACF this year and becoming part of it. I was impressed how you took the time to schedule 1-on-1s with everyone to get to know them. I’m looking forward to spending two more years with you and all of the Sophomores. I’ll always be Joe Goldberg ;o

vz.name: Evan
message: Vivia,

I’m not going to lie, every time we hang out I swear something crazy is going to happen. Those times are all very memorable though and definitely something I won’t forget. Hopefully you’re still working on your basketball skills and don’t haze the young freshmen too much in your sorority. Next year it’s probably going to get even crazier too. I’m not sure I’m ready for it.

vz.name: Evan Hao
message: Herro Vivia,

Hello. How do I join the sisterhood? Lol just kidding pls don’t kill me. I can see that popular vibe on you. Sometimes it’s blinding to me tbh. But anyways, I really I can see you next year and it was a pleasure sharing music with you 😊
Future sister,

jn.name: Bill
message: Hello Jacinda,

I feel like we don’t really talk but I wanted to let you know I feel you a good person. You seem like you are willing to help whenever anyone asks. I appreciate that you are so kind. You also have a bright personality. It’s too bad I never got to know you so well, but I hope the rest of college goes well and that you find success in whatever you want to do.

jn.name: Phil
message: Hey Jacinda!

I know you’re a busy gal but I wish I was able to see you more at AACF! You have such a positive and happy aura and it’s always fun seeing you and talking with you. Also thanks for planning the conjoined (that’s a gross word lol) small group with me and Leo, it’s always fun planning what the freshmen will do and they’re really lucky to have you as one of their leaders. You’re super kind, positive, smart and I really hope you can continue to stay strong, stay happy, and stay you even during this craziness!

jn.name: SK
message: jacindA
hi long time no speak :’)
you’re definitely killing it whatever you’re doing so i feel like i don’t even have to ask how you are hahaha..
but i hope you are well. it would be nice to hear a life update from you! i hear you’re taking on more of a leadership role in AACF now.. that’s hecka cool! i’m so proud of u!!!!
miss you all lots!

jn.name: George
message: Hi Jacinda!

Haven’t seen you around too much lately but I know you’re a busy bee with all that’s going on in info and beyond. Thanks for still stepping up to be a small group leader in spite of that, I know it’s probably not what you had in mind to do but I hope that it has been a fun learning experience for you. Sorry for dragging you into taking random classes like nutrition and music, but I appreciate that you’re always willing to show up to class with me and take those evil quizzes together. --Additional sorry for always crashing your dorm, I hope it wasn’t too much of a bother. Anyway, even if I won’t be at AACF next year, I think that everyone else will enjoy having you around, so please show up whenever you can find the time (no I’m not duty bound by core to tell you to go to large groups and in-reach events, but you should goooo). Nevertheless, good luck this summer + keep me posted about it and don’t be afraid to reach out if you ever need anything.

jn.name: KevK
message: Hey Jacinda!

It’s almost summer! (Yay?!?!) It was pretty awesome seeing you at the STLP office back in Winter Quarter—it was a while since I’d seen you around AACF Large Group and it was really great to hear from you, even if it was just a handful of minutes of catching up! Even though this school year’s been derailed for many of us, I hope you were still able to learn from, experience, and just enjoy the things you’ve done at UW—from helping folks with the STLP, to leading an AACF small group, and much much more. It is without a doubt that you’ll be able to continue to be a light in others’ lives with your kindness, care, and positivity!

al.name: Daniel
message: Hello Angie (Daniel),

It’s still hella funny how we met. I think it’s just funny and that awkward dinner with Connie LOL. This note is to make up for not really hanging out with you this year. If you don’t write one back to me, that just confirms I put more effort in this friendship. Who knows if you’re gonna come back to West campus ever again, but thanks for being your unapologetic self because that’s when you’re hella funny bro. We want savage Angie all the time and you know that. Keep bringing all your cards and other random games that you have. I swear that you have an unlimited amount of games. I feel like the only way we hang out is if we go on those crazy late night adventures so let’s do that this upcoming year. Gotta full send before we have to grow up.

al.name: Ryan
message: Hi Angie, it’s that time of the year LOL. I hope you understand by now how much I appreciate you. It’s been so cool to see you gradually become a stronger individual and a person that knows herself more with time. I know this year has really been a wild ride for you and that you may be tired of associating yourself with these fellowships. Follow your gut and discuss it with us, Angie.

Also, I just want to let you know that one of my favorite memories with you was when we were walking to Candice’s graduation and we were talking about life. That was a really chill time for me and I was really happy. Thank you for something so ordinary. I know you’ll figure out life one step at a time, even when I can’t walk life next to you for the remainder of your college years.

P.S. If you really meant it when you said one of the only reasons you’d willingly come back to Seattle is to come to see me, then I’m gonna really try to come back up here. Take care of yourself, Angela.

al.name: Evan Hao
message: Angela Liu

Puck you. But since this notes appreciation, I will say puck you in a nice way 😊. It’s great to meet popular people like you who are in both AACF and AAIV because of that phat clout ya feel? It was a blessing to meet you, and I hope to see you during Fall quarter.
Professional Instagrammie

ax.name: Matt
message: Angela
hEy! tHaT’s nOt vErY NiCe!

You clown >:(.  Thanks for always coming to fishies events even if they’re random and dumb.  I appreciate all the time we spend together and meme.  I can’t believe that you can tolerate studying in Alder with us too lmao.  I remember T44 fall quarter at chipotle and I lowkey thought you were calm but now I see you for the true chaotic being you are.  You bring a lot of laughter and memes into AACF and we all appreciate it :) Stop trolling in games. Sea for 7

ax.name: Joseph Tsang
message: Angela

You’re a fat clown. Well at least that’s what it seems like. I know you’re a hard worker and you probably grind 10 times harder than I do, and I always see your focus whenever we’re in Alder commons. I hope that I can know you better soon, cause we’re stuck together for a while. Stay chaotic. We need you.

ax.name: Ryan. P.S. “dats nawt vewwy noice”. >:(
message: Hi Angela,

Man you are a wild, wild lady. A big clown with big brain. Hey, listen, I honestly hope you had a good freshman year. Especially when you’ve spent extensive time with the… bois LOL. I respect your work ethic man. Keep at it but remember to always find time to enjoy life too. Do some fun stuff, do some dumb stuff, and more importantly cause some chaos. Live life while utilizing your strengths. Cause people to lose brain cells while you scoff at those imbeciles. Take it easy, and I’ll come visit once in a while! Have a great time in college and continue to love God and His people. Goodbye, budget kath.

ax.name: Leo Tsai
message: Angela,

Um um um, thanks for always being a wack clown whenever I see you lol. Also thanks for hard carrying me through 312, I’m full of dumb juice :( Looking forward to the next couple of years getting to hang out with you and the rest of the freshman. Hope you enjoyed your first year!

ax.name: Jed
message: HELLO.

Thanks for taking care of "bruh" Kath and going to small group most of the time. Become a CS genius and help out the boys, alright? I'm glad you have a blunt attitude because that makes you a simple, straightforward person. And that's a good thing, most of the time. Also quite impressed by your art of assimilation into the AACF wilds. Also you're great at PUBG I hear, so good work. Stay crazy.
I'll see you again some time when I visit Kath.

ab.name: Matt
message: So glad you could be a part of AACF and FISHIES.  It’s really awesome to see you come out to events and even retreat. I know we don’t hang out much but it’s easy to see that you’re super chill and easy to talk to so I hope we can get to know each other more next year.  Thanks for always being present and being friendly. I hope that God continues to grow you throughout college and that AACF will be able to serve your needs.

ab.name: Phil
message: Hi hi Amy!

I hope you’re doing well! It’s always great to see you both in large group and small group and I hope you continue to show up throughout your college years. You’re really sweet, positive, and kind and AACF as a community is really lucky to have you. You just have a warm aura and it’s always fun to talk with you. I hope you have a great and memorable college experience and I hope to see you when I visit in the future! Stay healthy, stay happy, and stay you!

sh2.name: Josh
message: Sarah

Hi, it’s your “little brother” Josh. Your vulnerability and openness in the times that we’ve had discussions together (i.e. that time we were chilling in Steph’s apartment until 2 or something) really encourages me because of just how powerful one’s testimony and story can be. I can see that you’re really rooted in God and I pray that you would continue to be a light to your two bros and to everyone else that’s around you, whether AACF, AAIV or otherwise.

ll.name: Josh
message: Lucy, you’re a funny and chill person to be around with and you bring smiles to the faces of the people in AACF, especially those who are considered the “clowns”. You’re an invaluable part of the freshmen group now, it seems, and AACF would feel very different without your bright personality :) If I don’t see you on zoom, I’ll see you next quarter (hopefully). See ya, “Kelly”.
Your Regional Manager,

ll.name: Zach C
message: Hi Lucy! Thanks for being an awesome sister in Christ. You have a fun sense of humor and you put a smile on everyone's face when you meet them. I'll admit, we haven't actually met very much but I appreciated that you welcomed me into Ryan's Discord server by calling me friend. I hope you continue to spread your fun personality to everyone you meet as well as grow in your relationship with God.

ll.name: Joseph Tsang
message: Lucy!

It’s been nice to be able to meet you in college. Out of all the people I expected to meet in college, I never thought that I would’ve met you. Tbh, our personalities don’t match at all, and I’m not sure how we’ve become friends, but I’m glad we did! I wasn’t sure if you’d like AACF when I invited you to the retreat, so I was genuinely pretty happy when you started making friends and liked this small place. We’re stuck together for the next few years, so hopefully we can have a lot of memories throughout the rest of college!
To the biggest clown in AACF,

ll.name: The Child Prodigy
message: Lucy,

Thanks for making my first year here at UW so enjoyable. As a 16 year old transitioning into college, it was hard to fit in, but you reached out to me when no one else did. I appreciate you always hanging out with me and helping me get used to life here in America!

ll.name: Evan Hao
message: Lucy

First off, lucy, you’re a clown. A literal clown. I need you to tone it done on the talking in movies and spoilers. Seriously. Anyways, that aside, you are honestly probably the biggest memer in AACF. Interpret whether that means something good or bad, but I think of it as good. Your presence never stops me from laughing. Again, that is up to how you want to interpret it XD. I hope to see you next year, but I might not since you’re really popular in AAIV too. Who knows though.
Normal person,
PS: TBH IDK how a normal person like Richard became your bf, but honestly, I’m really impressed; I guess your personality is just too good.

ac.name: Daniel
message: Yo Audrey, (Daniel)

This feels weird typing this stuff, but you gotta do what you gotta do. I think you were the first freshman that I met and I thank you for saying yes to all the times I asked you to hang out and do whatever. When Leo said what he said that first night of FISHIES, I knew that you were a pretty chill person and keep being chill like that. I know I haven’t asked y’all to hangout as much winter quarter and that’s on me for not reaching out as much. Part of that is because I’ve seen how you have found other people with Kath coming back and you being kinda tight with Amy. Keep exploring and finding different people especially the real ones. With that being said, just know that you can come to me with anything you’re struggling with or just as room to vent whatever you gotta vent about. We will struggle in Math 394 together, but we’ll grind it through. I encourage you to not put too much pressure on yourself with your GPA and to see what God has put around you and why He has done what He has. Keep pushing and hopefully this quarantine ends and there will be some normalcy by fall.

ac.name: Joseph Tsang
message: Audrey!

While we didn’t really get to know each other as well as I would’ve liked, I’m glad that you’re part of my grade. We actually have a butt ton of things in common, like league, anime, and general degenerate stuff. I remember being shook when I heard of your senior standing. I’m sure you work really hard, and I know that all the hard work that you put in will lead to great things! Don’t forget to do dumb fun stuff though! I’m sure we’ll be able to do some of that dumb stuff together, so yeah. I’ll see you back on campus soon!

ac.name: Leo Tsai
message: Audrey,

Thanks for always being so chill in Alder and for playing League with me on the off chance that I log in. Hope you’ve been enjoying your freshman year and not stressing too much over school. Try to not stay up too late doing homework, take it easy!

ac.name: Jed
message: Hi!
You should know that dining and dashing is not acceptable. Please know your limits, and stick to playing League.

Speaking of which, good luck on the ranked climb. I have long since given up on ranked so respect for you. If you give up, no shame! You're probably only doing this because you're bored anyway. If you are, let's play some other more relaxing and non flame-inducing game together, like Minecraft.
GoOdbYe fElLoW gAMer.

ac.name: Evan Hao
message: Audrey

What’s up weeber. I started writing my notes at 6 pm, so no flamerito pls. You such an epic memer and gamer--probably the best League of Legends e-girl in AACF. Overall, it was really fun talking and meeting you. Thanks for being a part of AACF, and I hope to see you next year 😊
Not a weeb or gamer (I only study),

bc.name: Josh
message: Briawna,

It’s certainly been a while since we’ve talked, but from the times we’ve participated in the discussions together, I’m always inspired by your biblical and Scriptural knowledge. Looks like all that Awana in elementary stuck with at least one of us haha. I’m sure you add to discussions in small groups, and I hope you can continue to be a resource for not only your freshwomen community but for everyone else!

bc2.name: KevK
message: Hey Bethany,

You made it to SAD/BAD! It was really cool meeting you during Zoom for Four and also having you at AACF Retreat. I know you’re not quite in college yet, but that just means you’ve got so many more years ahead of us older peeps to enjoy the younger, more care-free years of life. Not to mention, more years ahead to leave a lasting impact on others! Stay curious, be full of wonder, and buckle up for the upcoming years ahead. I guarantee you it’ll be one heck of a ride, but also one that’ll hopefully challenge you and grow you in so many ways. I’m excited to hear about what you’ll end up doing in the future, regardless of where you go and what you pursue. You’re always welcome to join us and we at AACF shall patiently await for your arrival ;)

yy.name: Bill Wang
message: Hi Yu Ann

I hope life has been treating you well this quarter. I think of you as a very brave person and I think you will make a large impact at AACF for years to come. You are full of life and joy and it is inspiring for me to see that in freshman person like you. Please enjoy your time in college and in fellowship. Keep doing you and you will achieve the world.

yy.name: Zach C
message: Yu-Ann Youn

Hi Yu-Ann! Thanks for being an awesome sister in Christ and for helping out with worship! You sound encouraging when you sing for worship during AACF and it's helped everyone feel closer to God. I'm inspired by your Tuned-In post and how you realized that God made you who you needed to be and how your journey at UW and at AACF came together. I hope your walk with God would continue to inspire others in their walk with God and encourage the people you meet.

yy.name: Lewis
message: Hello Yu-Ann

It’s been such a surprise getting to know you and serving with you. You have a boldness that I think even you do not fully realize. You are capable of more than you give yourself credit for. I pray that the Lord continues to encourage you in this way as you navigate college. I pray that He will help you conquer all your fears and insecurities. Your heart is large and capable and I know that you’re going to come out ahead through all your ups and downs in college. You have an incredible servant’s heart. It’s been an absolute joy.

yy.name: Joseph Tsang
message: Hey Yu-Ann

While we didn’t really have a chance to get to know each other personally, it was still fun to see you around all the worship practices. I know my sister has done a lot of stuff with you, and I hope that you’ll be able to grow and serve. It’s awesome seeing you be on worship, and you have a ton of talent that is being put to good use. While our freshmen year was cut short, I’m sure that we’ll be able to get to know each other better throughout college, and I’m glad to have you in our class!

yy.name: George
message: Hi Yoon!

Wow what a nickname. Anyways, thanks for being the coolest little sister (TMI: my mom always wanted my brother and I to have a little sister but we adamantly refused). It’s simply been amazing to see you grow and become a part of the AACF family. Whenever I hold worship practice, you’re one of the few people that I expect to be there, and that really motivates me to keep on coordinating week after week. Aside from worship, it’s been a lot of fun hanging out with you, whether it’s going on adventures or going to class. Although I probably won’t be here next year, I look forward to seeing how things turn out for you. You’ve got a lot of resilience, positivity, and experience within you, and I think that you will accomplish a great deal of amazing things in the next few years. Soooo whenever I get around to building my own house, I’ll give you a call. Anyway, don’t be afraid to reach out whenever you need anything, although I usually google about 90% of the questions you ask me (hey google is smarter than me so it makes sense).

yy.name: KevK
message: Hey Yu-Ann!

It’s been a blessing having you in AACF and it’s awesome seeing you join the AACF Fam and to see you with the worship team. Can I say this, or is it too weird… I’ll just say it—you go girl! You’ve got a lot of years ahead and I’m excited to see how God will work through your life to be a light to others and grow you to be even more awesom-er by the time you emerge from college. We’re lucky to have you in AACF!

yy.name: Evan
message: Herro Yu-Ann
You are by far one of the most mature 16 (If this year is wrong I am so very sorry pls don’t end me) year old I have ever met.

I am really glad I got to meet you one-on-one as well and got to know you a bit better (including your testimony (I think that’s what it’s called again I’m so sorry this note is last minute)). If people ever ask why God exists, people like you clearly show why God exists. Your overall attitude and presence you exert are just so nice to be around. To be honest, regardless of age, I would see you as a role model for what I want my faith to follow. I am very glad you skipped some grades so we could be in the same year, and I hope to see you in the following year (rip corona).
PS: Construction management is an op major. I never knew about it until I met you.
Sincerely,
